person.persName: The State of Washington et al.

org.orgName: United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington.

div1.ab: The President of the United States of America,
div1.p: To the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

Whereas, lately in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington before you, or some of you, in a cause between entitled In the matter of the application of Henry Craemer for a writ of habeas corpus wherein the order of the said Circuit Court entered in said cause on the 14th day of June, A.D. 1897, is in the following words, viz:
In the Matter of the Application of HENRY CRAEMER for Write of Habeas Corpus and Relief Thereon.

This cause coming on for hearing upon the petition of petitioner for a writ of habeas corpus, the court, being advised upon the petition and upon hearing counsel for petitioner, denies and refuses to grant the said writ; to which ruling of the court petitioner excepts; exception allowed.

Petitioner thereupon gives notice that he appeals from the said ruling of the court and from the whole and every part thereof, and appeals his said petition and his said cause and the whole and each and every part thereof to the Supreme Court of the United States, holding terms at the city of Washington, District of Columbia, and to the next regular term thereof, and particularly appeals from said rulings of the said court denying and refusing to grant the said writ of habeas corpus.
Which said appeal is here and now allowed.
Done in open court this 14th day of June, 1897.

as by the inspection fo the transcript of the record of the said Circuit Court, which was brought into the Supreme Court of the United States by virtue of an appeal taken by Henry Craemer whereon The State of Washington and W. H. Moyer, Sheriff of King County, were made appelents agreeably to the act of Congress, in such case made and provided, fully and at large appears.

And whereas, in the present term of October, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety = seven, the said cause came on to be heard before the said Supreme Court, on the said transcript of record, and was argued by counsel:

On consideration whereof, It is now here ordered, adjudged, and decreed by this Court that the order of the said Circuit Court in this cause be, and the same is hereby, affirmed with costs; and that the said The State of Washington and W. H. Moyer, Sheriff & recover, against the said Henry Craemer Fifty- seven dollars for their costs herein expended and have execution therefor. October 25, 1897.

You, therefore, are hereby commanded that such execution and proceedings be had in said cause, as according to right and justice, and the laws of the United States, ought to be had, the said appeal notwithstanding.
Witness the Honorable Melville W. Fuller, Chief Justice of the United States, the 22d day of December, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety=seven
COSTS OF The State of Washington etal. Clerk $21.50 Printing Record $15.50 Attorney $20.00 } $57.00
div1.ab: James H. McKenney Clerk of the Supreme Court of the United States
div1.p: SUPREME COURT OF THE UNITED STATES No. 466, October Term, 1897.
Henry Craemer vs. The State of Washington etal.
FILED Dec 31 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT.
div1.ab: A. Reeves Ayres. CLERK by RM Hopkins DEPUTY
